etymology.description: Corruption of 邪(邪) (yé, "wrong") -> phonetic component
etymology.interpretation: The character 耶(yē) evolved as a corruption of 邪(邪) (yé, "wrong") to serve as a phonetic component in Chinese characters. The original character 邪(邪) combined 牙(牙) (yá, "tooth") as the phonetic part and 邑(邑) (yì, "town; city") as the semantic part, suggesting its use in place names like 琅邪(lángyé).

examples.chinese: 这个字的声旁是耶(這個字的聲旁是耶)。
examples.pinyin: Zhège zì de shēngpáng shì yē.
examples.english: The phonetic component of this character is yē.

examples.chinese: 他研究汉字构造(他研究漢字構造)，发现耶常作表音符号(發現耶常作表音符號)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yánjiū hànzì gòuzào， fāxiàn yē cháng zuò biǎoyīn fúhào.
examples.english: He studies the structure of Chinese characters, and finds that yē often serves as the phonetic element.
